intro: Lomaria distans, commonly known as the distant lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Lomaria distans is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
